questions.text: I have people who know my specific sin struggles — not vague 'accountability' but real knowledge of real battles.
I have people I can confess to without fear of judgment or rejection — they'll hold me accountable AND hold me close.
I know my friends' struggles and actively support their sanctification — it's mutual, not just me receiving.
When I fall, I have people I tell promptly — I don't hide and hope no one notices.
My sanctification relationships help me actually change, not just feel supported — they challenge, not just comfort.
